name: Defender Morrill
descriptions: Defender Morrill is a member of the Brotherhood Outcasts located at Bailey's Crossroads in the Fallout 3 add-on Operation: Anchorage. He stays outside the facility with the Outcasts to defend against periodic attacks from the super mutants.

Morrill is a veteran soldier who has fought in more battles than he would like, operating under the command of Protector McGraw. His latest assignment is at the VSS facility at Bailey's Crossroads, where he coordinates surface defenses against hordes of super mutants determined to wipe the Outcasts out. He also performs special operations for McGraw, such as a daring raid on Vault 108 and the abduction of Gary 23, in an attempt to acquire a Pip-Boy necessary to crack the VSS vault.

However, the attempt failed: Gary 23 died under interrogation, Specialist Olin is back at square one, and Morrill is stuck trying to keep the super mutants at bay. Due to a recent surge in their activity, Morrill decided to send out an urgent radio broadcast for help, requesting any available Outcasts to come to their aid at sector 7-B - Bailey's Crossroads.
Defender Morrill appears only in the Fallout 3 add-on Operation: Anchorage.

Outcast members Sibley, Olin, McGraw and Morrill, all of who appear in the Fallout 3 add-on Operation: Anchorage, appear to be named after buildings on the campus of Cornell University, including Sibley Hall, Olin Hall, Olin Library, McGraw Hall, McGraw Tower and Morrill Hall.
detailed_location: Bailey's Crossroads, near elevator toOutcast outpost

topics.response_text: About damn time the reinforcements showed up! Fall in, soldier!

topics.topic_text: I'm not one of your soldiers. I just like wearing your armor.
topics.response_text: What? Just who the hell are you, some local? You got a death wish, walking around in our...{surprised, annoyed - gets distracted and trails off}

topics.topic_text: Uhh, the rest of the guys should be here any second now. <Lie>
topics.response_text: All right, we'll probably need their help. Mutants'll be back before long.

topics.topic_text: Can it, soldier! Who's in charge of this mess? I want his head on a platter!
topics.response_text: Uhh, that'd be Protector McGraw... Sir. He's... he's inside. Go ahead in.

topics.topic_text: What, this armor? I found it. Honest.
topics.response_text: Uh huh. Well, now that you've been nice enough to return it to us...

topics.topic_text: Yeah, I had to kill a few of your guys to get a suit that looked good on me.
topics.response_text: You filthy fucking wastelander... You're dead, you hear me? Dead!

topics.topic_text: I'm not looking for trouble. I'm just here because of the radio signal.
topics.response_text: You heard our signal? How'd you manage that? It's not broadcast on a standard frequency...

topics.topic_text: This? It's my Pip-Boy 3000. Want to see?
topics.response_text: Isn't that fancy. Listen kid, maybe you could help us out. We've been looking for someone like you.

topics.topic_text: Yes, it's mine, and before you ask, no you can't have it.
topics.response_text: Slow down there, kid. I'm not asking for it.

topics.topic_text: Who cares about my Pip-Boy? I'm here to find out what's going on.
topics.response_text: Okay, okay. I'm sure Protector McGraw will be happy to tell you.
Head inside, soldier. Report to McGraw and then get back out here to help us fortify these defenses.
...the hell do you think you're doing?
What the hell do you think you're doing?
Shut it, grunt. I'm not taking orders from anyone but McGraw. Now if you're done yapping, get inside and report for new orders.

conversation.response_text: Morrill calling in... Yeah, we took care of 'em. Listen, I'm sending down a local. You'll want to talk to this one. Yeah, exactly. Morrill out.
Outcasts, we've got to secure those ruins before we can reach the base!
All mutants have been put down. Outcasts, proceed to the base!
Point secure. That just leaves these mutants in the ruins. Outcasts, move out!
Look, I'm sorry if I upset you. Okay? I'll just... get back to my duties now. No problem.
Don't you get the feeling that this is all just a waste of time? I mean, how do we REALLY know that simulation gives access to the tech?
What? You cannot be serious. Just... stop talking. You're going to get us both killed.
I know, I know... It's just...

combat.response_text: That's about the smartest decision you ever made.
